factoid: Denísov shouted "A dog astwide a fence! A weal dog astwide a fence!" at a cavalryman.
Denísov described the expression he used as the most insulting expression a cavalryman can address to a mounted infantryman.
Denísov rode up to Rostóv and burst out laughing.
Denísov claimed he had taken transports from the infantry by force.
Denísov said he could not let their men starve.
Wagons that reached the hussars were consigned to an infantry regiment.
Lavrúshka informed Denísov that the transport was unescorted.
Denísov and his hussars seized the transport by force.
Soldiers were given biscuits freely.
Soldiers shared biscuits with other squadrons.
The regimental commander sent for Denísov.
The regimental commander advised Denísov to ride to the staff, settle the business in the commissariat department, and sign a receipt for stores received.
The regimental commander warned that if Denísov did not sign, a row could occur and the affair might end badly.
Denísov rode to the staff following the advice.
Denísov returned to his dugout in an unprecedented state.
Denísov could not speak and gasped for breath.
Denísov uttered incoherent oaths and threats when Rostóv asked what was the matter.
Rostóv advised Denísov to undress, drink water, and send for the doctor.
The regimental doctor said it was necessary to bleed Denísov.
A deep saucer of black blood was taken from Denísov's hairy arm.
After bleeding, Denísov was able to relate what had happened.
Denísov asked where the chief's quarters were.
Denísov was pointed to the chief's quarters.
Denísov said he had ridden twenty miles, had duties, and no time to wait, and asked to be announced.
The head chief lectured Denísov saying "It’s wobbewy!".
Denísov said wobbewy is not done by a man who seizes provisions to feed soldiers, but by one who takes them to fill his own pockets.
The head chief told Denísov to give a receipt to the commissioner, but the affair would be passed to headquarters.
Denísov went to the commissioner.
Denísov shouted "Who is it that’s starving us?".
Denísov hit the table with his newly bled arm so violently that the table nearly broke down and tumblers jumped.
Denísov shouted "Telyánin! What? So it’s you who’s starving us to death! Is it? Take this and this!".
Denísov hit Telyánin and shouted "Ah, what a... what a...!".
Denísov said he had had a bit of fun.
Denísov was gleeful and angry, with white teeth showing under a black mustache.
Denísov said he would have killed Telyánin if they hadn't taken him away.
Rostóv told Denísov to calm himself.
Rostóv told Denísov to tie up his bleeding arm again.
Denísov was bandaged again and put to bed.
The next day Denísov woke calm and cheerful.
